intro: Paraboea planiflora, commonly known as the flat-flowered paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Paraboea planiflora is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid conditions.
